description: diamond-shaped box, slightly flaring from base; 2 small football-shaped holes at center of lid; interior glazed green; exterior glazed white with green at 2 corners on lid and sides of box
dimension: H.5-5/8 x W.5-3/4 x D.5-1/4 in. (overall)
markings: \' K [inside a square]\', stamped into clay on one side near base
text:
Local artists Jan McKeachie-Johnston and Maren Kloppmann's ceramics represent two dramatically different aesthetics.  McKeachie-Johnston derives inspiration from an eclectic mix of historical sources - African pottery, Native American basketry, and contemporary Japanese ceramics - which are felt in the rich surface pattern, deep colors, and striking abstract form of this vessel.  

In contrast, the German-born Kloppmann is known for her modernist approach.  Symmetrical and geometric vessels like her Covered Box convey the clean, minimalist aesthetic of Europe in the 1930s, still appreciated today.
title: Covered box
